reviewText:
This game is freaking awesome, it's more of an orbital bombradments than classic TD, but still you have towers to protect your core.

+Juicy graphics, explosions, this game just looks cool despite how simplified it is.
+Great music - different music tracks, not getting bored by them and they are good.
+Nice strategy game - well strategy varies depending on your current upgrades, on the mission targets, and on how do you plan to win, you can build a lot of turrets or you can build a lot of RAM income and less turrets if you have upgraded guns and rockets.
+Nice balanced difficulty - easy mods are easy @ gold medal mod is pretty challenging.
+You can compare your results for every mission completed with other people (like top 3% overall score or top 68%)
+Steam achivements, steam cards
+Cheap
-None

And the most surprising part is that all of that stuff have been made by a single person :O
voteText: 10 of 10 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
No problems/bugs encountered so far.
The game itself has a unique concept where you have to fend off invaders by using a combination of different weapons, each with its own advantages and flaws. Stronger weapons have, in general a longer cooldown, etc
There is often a delay between firing and the projectiles actually hitting their targets, so smart aiming and predicting your targets' movements is essential.
It is based on the tower defense gameplay but unlike most tower defense games you dont just place them and wait what happens. You have to actively destroy your enemies.
voteText: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
A fresh, visually appealing, take on tower defense. It's a difficult feeling to describe how well this game seems to coalesce all its various parts into such a harmonious experience. The audio track, the visual experience and the gameplay blend together to deliver quite a satisfying gaming session. I guess that's the benefit of being a one person dev-team, you have the opportunity to create and refine the experience into exactly what you want without hindrance.
A very talented solo indie-dev.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: A very interesting mash-up of several game types:  tower defense, the old Missile Command arcade game, and lightweight RTS base-building, all overlaid onto a Tron-like theme.  Gameplay is engrossing and the level of freneticism can be dialed up or down according to your preference.\n\nThis talented young indie developer clearly has a bright future in game design and deserves your support.  The amount of money he's asking for this little gem is a pittance; I spend more on breakfast every day.  Give this guy some coins so he can keep doing what he's obviously very good at without being weighed down by the whims of greedy investors and idiot MBAs.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Artificial Defense takes simple abstract graphics and makes them feel clustered and complete for a full, if very casual, tower defense / orbital bomber defense.

Full video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GRRo_ptYtOU

Summary:
The sound and graphics make this game gel, giving it much needed activity and ambiance where it would otherwise be a more bland and abstract tower defense hybrid.

The variety of challenges and levels do provide a nice bit of progression, but while they look, feel and behave just great, I do have concerns in the pacing with some of the games. Especially the survive X time" and "get X Ram" challenges can end up being a game of see and wait. Higher difficulty does alleviate a bit of this
date: but there are some issues with that...\n\n..as the higher difficulties are flat out "upgrade" locked
recommended: and impossible if you don't unlock the higher end upgrades
hoursPlayed: so there is no reason to revisit an older challenge once you complete it at gold
voteText: because it'll only become easier due to higher upgrades.\n\nThe upgrade system is the games weakest part
helpfulPercent: being a flat and linear upgrade system. No reason to mix and match and no thinking needed. Just get the next one asap to make challenges easier / possible to complete. I feel this is also the part where the game lets me down the most. I have no reason to "switch it up" based on a challenge
votesHelpful: i know that if i fail
votesTotal: i just wait to upgrade and that does remove some of the tension of otherwise pretty compelling game play.\n\nAnd while the game is limited in it's scope
votesFunny: the game play and map design does make up for it a fair bit. With towers being restricted

column17: the game throws in a few curve balls with map design and unit variety (in mechanic
column18: if not look and feel). Forcing you to be active across the map and keep track of several things at the same time makes this game shine at it's best.\n\nIt feels great to switch between dropping a tower

column21:
switching to my machine gun to take out a roaming ram unit switching to different part of the map to make sure i'm not getting overwhelmed on that side... it's pretty good fun and most challenges take 5-10 minutes to complete - win or lose.


Overall a nice and fun casual experience for short bursts

reviewText:
Product received for free

An Orbital Shooter Tower Defense Gamehttps://youtu.be/Db9Z8qDk0NY
+ Conceptually this game is incredibly creative and unique as you essentially battle against cyber attacks such as malware and viruses on a virtual computer system.
+ The level design itself is very interesting, you play on top of a motherboard and can see various computer parts running such as the hard drive, OS, CPU, and so fourth and the enemies tend to come out of USB ports
+ Fun addictive gameplay, you mainly shoot a variety of guns and bombs from the sky to destroy enemies but these cost \RAM" (or ammo)
recommended: and also use your OS to capture various points and honeypots. You can then continu to rain hell from the sky while also building automated turrets to intercept enemies that get by.\n+ You can upgrade your weapons
voteText: and so fourth with currency you get from completing challenging and levels\n+ Great Electronic Soundtrack\n+ Personally
helpfulPercent:
I feel this game is really refreshing to a rather stale TD Genre

- I found it a bit strange that each level continue to plays even after you complete your objectives and will continue until your OS dies or you manually "Shutdown". While not really a problem I sort of felt like I was quitting out or aborting rather than finishing the level (which seems to go on endlessly until you shutdown).
- The "bosses" are not very threatening

reviewText:
Product received for free

Note: I decided to change my review because it was waaay too looong and probably intimidating... (Sorry about that, I just love writing long stuff.)

For a game developed by only ONE person, I am indeed impressed by how he managed to create something as awesome for a small game as Artificial Defense. I've been supporting/following this game ever since its early development. I admit, I was interested in its simple concept: Top-view shooter game where you shoot at things trying to intrude your system (base) about a computer (the player) trying to defend itself from waves of triangular viruses that want to make the computer explode. (This would be funnier if it features a virtual BSOD)

Goodies(Things I liked about the game)

‚Ä¢ Interface has simple design, with right combination of colors such as light blue and white, or yellow and gray, which makes the letters and signs visible.
‚Ä¢ Simplicity in graphics and animation, requiring almost minimal system (the real one) requirements.
‚Ä¢ Bits of humor in certain descriptions. (Herb needs a lesson, too.)
‚Ä¢ Mixture of attack/defend. No rush. It's only a bunch of creeps approaching your OS from all directions.
‚Ä¢ Ability to choose system upgrades (weaps, def. towers, hardware) with freedom, in between missions/levels.
‚Ä¢ 7 different maps/levels with different soundtracks and difficulties.
‚Ä¢ Groovy techno-style (correct me if I'm wrong with the genre) background music.
‚Ä¢ Difficult and challenging gameplay. (Git gud)
‚Ä¢ Rage-inducing worms.

Baddies(Some issues/Things that I dislike. Of course, I don't want to be biased.)

‚Ä¢ Interface can be a bit confusing at first look. I guess it happens to almost all games, anyway.
‚Ä¢ Some tasks in missions can be found repetitive.
‚Ä¢ Rage-inducing worms.

Overall, I enjoyed playing the game and I've spent quite some time with it. Needs some improvement for the replay-value, though. ;)

reviewText:
Product received for free

The interface is awesome, and so is the music. I noticed myself sitting and nodding in beat with the music as soon as I got into the menu, and that continued ingame.

The tutorials were easy to understand but didn't prepare me for the first actual level of the game. It was quite dificult since I didn't have the tools available I had in the tutorials. That's not a huge problem though as you gather points to buy improved tools and weapons  from every mission played, even if you fail.

All in all this seems like a fun take on tower defense games. If anything changes about my feelings about the game as I continue to play I'll update this review.

Edit: I've played for several hours now, and I'm loving it! It's really the kind of game you get better and better at, both through upgrades and through skill. Things can get quite intense, and when you finish a level after that you feel quite accomplished. :P

Disclaimer: I received this game for free from the developer, but with no obligations attached.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nArtificial Defense is a nice and very polished Tower Defense like RTS game with a unique theme. This is not your usual casual orbital shooter. The way the weapons work requires careful timing/aiming in order to maximise their effectiveness. It requires real skill and poses quite a challenge!

reviewText:
Product received for free

After just an hour or so of playing I'm thoroughly enjoying this game. Its a nice mix of RTS and TD and looks really stunning. I don't think I've ever oohed and ahhed at User Interface menus as much as I have in this game. The game feels pretty challenging because it has a last as long as you can" mechanic with more and more chaos to deal with as each game progresses. There is a precision component which means as you get more frantic and stressed you need to keep your cool and be accurate with your aiming. Its a nice way to test how calm you can remain under pressure.

Oh
date: and there is a DJ playing some totally cool tunes. Gives the whole game a really nice vibe."

reviewText:
Amazing music that really fits the game.
A very nice combination of top down shooter and tower defense.
With a innovative design, and theme, i love the whole aspect of using motherboards and such for levels.
Overall really nice design, abit confusing button system but a well made tutorial system helps you through this.
From the beginning you can tell its a nice polished game.
Awesome work, congratulations & thank you so much for letting me try this, i will definately be spending alot of hours in this game!
Cheers.

reviewText:
Product received for free

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sYdpgQJ6U-4

I've played tower defense games, but this one is on steroids. There's so many things to keep track of, but it's RTS mechanics and general theme sets it apart from everyone else.

The graphics are damn good, the soundtrack equally as amazing. Gotta say, I love the boxy-DJ spinning the tracks! The controls are complex, but well-explained in the tutorials. While this supports controllers, I'd recommend keyboard & mouse for the simplicity.

Overall, if you're looking for a challenge, this is the perfect game for you.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nAt the time of writing this, I have only played a bit through the tutorial of this game.  I was one of the lucky folks who was given a Steam key for this game by the developer himself as a sort of launch celebration.  Thus far into playing it, I highly recommend this game.  It has a very sleek UI along with a pretty good soundtrack.  The general theme and feel of the game is fairly consistent and, if you enjoy other tower defense games or orbital shooters, you're likely to enjoy this as well.  The camera controls can be a bit tricky to pick up as the stage seems to constantly rotate at a slow pace.  All in all though, this game is well done and I'd pass it a solid recommendation.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nArtificial Defense is a new take on the original tower defense genre, and incorporates orbital shooter mechanics in such a way that it all makes a good synergy. The biggest strength of the game is that the game is very unforgiving and it requires you to think through all the different strategies, placements and weapons at your disposal. It must be said that even though it's a very unforgiving game, it also comes with a very steep learning curve, so be ready to rage a bit and retry some levels after the tutorials.
